website_summaries.verdict: With its many features as well as its compatibility with audiobooks and subscription-based music, the SanDisk Sansa m200 series is an overall great value.
pros: includes FM tuner and voice recorder
compatible with WMA DRM 10 (Janus) and Audible files
cons: only one quality option for voice recording

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Although the plastic cover, strap and ear buds gave out. the mp3 player is still going strong and it is very economical with battery usage. If all you want to do is listen to podcasts and FM radio you cannot do better than this unit. One thing about the FM radio though if you listen while walking along a road you will get static whenever a car passes, it is very sensitive. Inference is not a problen with podcasts though. Since the Sansa supports drag and drop file transfer updating weekly broadcasts is super easy using a computer pod catcher, just delete old, and drop new from podcast folder to sansa.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dahlem

customer_reviews.title: Good Player for Price
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to focus on the product when the service that came with it left much to be desired. On the Amazon.com website it indicated that the SanDisk Sansa M240 comes with case, armband, earphones, 1 AAA battery, CD and user guide. Least to say the user guide, CD and battery were missing. However, Amazon customer service was very prompt in responding to my query. Unfortunately, the player is being used outside of the US, so when my computer failed to recognise it I had to employ a computer expert in my own country to reconfigure the player. Thankfully it now works. Amazon should ensure that what they have stated on the website is what the customer actually gets.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player to use while running, and have also successfully formatted it to use with Ubuntu Linux as an operating system instead of Windows. It is very easy to learn to use and offers excellent sound quality for the money, especially if you want a simple and basic player for everyday use. My only tip for improvement would be that if you want to use the player while exercising, the armband and case that come with it are not adequate (a flimsy clear vinyl pouch with a snap and an armband that chafed pretty badly); spring for the silicone case which has a sturdy clip that you can attach to your shorts or water carrier. Otherwise very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Mckay

customer_reviews.title: use it for running and very happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these as a gift for a friend. I then used it a few times while she wasn't, and I liked it so much that I just bought one for myself. I use it almost exclusively while running so I did not want to spend a lot in case I damaged it. It has held up very well with pretty heavy usage. It comes with a clear protective plastic case and an armband that fits comfortably. I'm not worried when I press the buttons with sweaty fingers. I've dropped it a few times and it's fine. Also, it's half the price and has much more features than the $89 dollar ipod. I definitely recommend this SanDisk Sansa.
customer_reviews.author: ch

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: This is just about perfect, especially after adding different ear pieces. That is only because I don't really like in-the-ear ones. I use this primarily for downloading books from audible. It works seamlessly and you can really pack the books on it and also have room for lots of music. I have 2 5 plus hour books on it now and about 30 mp3s/wmas and it is less than a third full. It is pretty tough too. After dropping it a few times, even in a little water(not recommended but I was too close to the tub and caught it just in time) it still works great! I plan on buying 2 for Christmas(from Amazon of course! Get it!
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Good one to use on the road
customer_reviews.text: Old school and runs on alkaline battery. Probably not the most up to date gadget but back in the day it was good to have on the road, and you don't have to drain your phone's battery.
customer_reviews.author: X. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Sound!!
customer_reviews.text: This tiny player does his work and then more!! The sound coming from it is incredible!! It's so easy to use! I had no problems downloading music from CD's or websites, because it takes less than a second! The Player comes with USB cable and when I plugged it to my PC, it recognized the player instantly! I tested the "delete" function and this was easily done as well, either from the player itself or from the screen, deleting is NOT cumbersome. I also tested the radio and it seems to grasp the stations well also. So far, no problems. I love this product and I think I will buy some more as a gift to others!
customer_reviews.author: By the Window At Work

customer_reviews.title: GREAT gift for a music lover!
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth SanDisk MP3 player to enter this household, and it's not because the other ones have bit the dust. Quite the contrary! These are great little devices that have awesome sound, hold a great amount of music, and really withstand the test of time. This was a gift for a family member who has a ton of music on her computer. She can now listen to music while doing dishes, working out, doing whatever. It was a great gift, VERY affordable, and just, well, I'm sure, once again withstand the test of time and has already gotten a LOT of use. A great product for the $!
customer_reviews.author: L. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Very Good quality Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because of the low price, However the quality is awesome we are talking about a Sandisk you know' the name brand is a very hi quality one. Yes buy this unit it will impress you. it has a 7 band EQ that really works great and also sound awesome with better headphones rather than the earbuds. when buying the headphones try Panasonic,Sony these 2 brands offer very good sound at affordability, but make sure you get a pair with 40 mm drivers,100db or more and frequency response of 20 or less to 25,000 khz or higher. this makes all the difference in the world.
customer_reviews.author: CDG Technical Writer

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving this item
customer_reviews.text: I use this item at work and play although more often at work..... it's been dropped many times and still works perfectly it interacts with the macbook fairly well and I have enjoyed many audiobooks. Thank you Sansa. I often grab this rather than my apple iPod because if it got damaged .....It has already passed it's life expectancy although i would be sad. Radio reception is pretty good, both sports stations come in very well.
customer_reviews.author: William m.

customer_reviews.title: What a great disappointment
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I felt this would be a great MP3 player. I bought two for my children for Christmas from Amazon. With in one week the first one stopped responding. The following week the second stopped responding. Amazon replaced them. Now three months later the same thing has happened. The MP3 player has stopped responding. Cannot play music, cannot connect it to the computer. As someone who normally buys Sandisk product I am greatly disappointed in this product. The same thing happened three times. It will be a long time before I purchase another Sandisk product,
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Drumm

customer_reviews.title: File access...
customer_reviews.text: The sound and the storage memory for file are good. Moreover, the sounds are recorded by it are clear. However, it seems not compatible to Microsoft XP. I tried several times to reach the recorded files, but the computer cannot find the device most of the time. Or the computer found the device, but it can not open the device file folder. That's really annoying. Besides, the shape of it may be design for holding. When I want to place on the table to record lecture, it swayed on the table and the sound of swaying also recorded in the file. Thus, it's not a shape for recording.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Y. Fang

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit for a little more than a month and so far so good. Had the NANO and took it for a trail run- ruined it :( But, this is even better unit. Has artist and song info, bigger screen, better sound, longer bat life. The size is a bit bigger but for a size of a pack of large gum you cant beat this. Holds about 300 songs on good quality- maybe more :) -not sure yet. I would say if you get this at around $60.00 and use it for communting, exercise, or just doing work around your place you will be a happy little consumer. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: A. Longano

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this player/but 1 year later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to listen to audio book from the library. It is compatitable with the software and and so far has worked perfectly. If you put this on pause and let it power down by itself, the next time you turn it on it will be exactly where you left off. I havent figured all the settings and stuff out yet but for what I've been using it for it's great. After about 6 months the buttons don't work very well. I have to push repeatedly to get it to pause or unpause, ff, rewind, etc. Also I can't turn it down which is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: M.C. Mattiello

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - Simple, quick, hassle-free.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. If you're only looking to play MP3's like me, and don't want to spring for an IPOD just yet, this is a great little player. Easy to use, sounds great, not over-laden with features you don't need. A simple tool to get the job done quickly, easily, and enjoyably. Not to mention the fact that it's so small and light you can use it anywhere. Even in a shirt pocket there's no weightiness to it. Very very nice. I knew I could trust SanDisk. Mark Huntington Beach, Ca.
customer_reviews.author: Mhan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago for my daughter at Christmas. It just locked up on us. It hasn't even been used much. I googled this model and the word "locked up" and found it is common for this model. Update: I'm not a techie type but I took the advice on some website and hooked our player up to the computer with a USB, then I went to "My Computer" and right clicked on the Sansa icon. I selected reformat and it reformatted the player. It wiped everything out and I had to reload songs on it, however it is working again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice mp3 Player!  Tech Support Speaks English!!!
customer_reviews.text: The mp3 player had an initialization error when I first recieved it, but a quick call to the Tech Support got my problem taken care of! It is very rare to get free,quality,english language technical support these days, and SanDisk rated an A++. The mp3 player was very easy to use. It utilizes either drag and drop, or Windows Media Player to get songs from the computer. My 9 and 11 year old kids find it easy to use, and I find the quality to be great. The fm radio reception appears to work better than I expected. The 1Gb capacity provides ample storage for 300-400 songs. I would buy a SanDisk again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the IPod
customer_reviews.text: Great first time MP3 for my two kids, ages 9 and 11. Didn't want to invest $200 on something they may or may not use, may lose, or otherwise destroy. Bought our first one in December 2005. Bought our second one in Jaunary 2006. The SanDisk MP3 is very user friendly, easy to download music to and easy to navigate - especially for MP3 newbies. Good sound quality, long battery life, easy-to-read display (shows song playing, battery life remaining, number of songs on player, and more) all add up to a great little MP3 player.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hettrick

customer_reviews.title: Great value - great little MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this MP3 player after several hours of researching and reading online reviews. The MP3 player has actually exceeded my expectations. I love the fact that a AAA battery lasts a LONG time. I have also been pleased with the amount of music that a 1GB player will hold. So far, I have put 14 full albums on the player and I still have about 275MB of free space. The sound is great even using the WMA format. I highly recommend the SanDisk Sansa M240. ***UPDATE*** This product stopped working the day after I wrote this review, after using it for only 10 days. Apparently there are several others with the same problem. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: peachypitt2112

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk Sansa m240
customer_reviews.text: I Use this little devil primarily for audio books since it remembers where you left off and goes right back. I find the sound qaulity to be much better than average and better than the Zen V plus that I also own. A big plus is that the battery is replaceable and requires only 1 AAA. Oh Yes, one can replace the battery and it still goes back to the place where one left off unlike so many others that loose there place during that process (great for audio books). Screen is hard to read but if you have enough light, it does have a blue backlight which works well, it should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Irvin Rappaport

customer_reviews.title: worked great until it went haywire
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little MP3 player, until the software decided to go haywire. I called customer support, and they had me go through a bunch of steps to wipe it clean. It then worked again for a little while before going haywire again. I can still use it to listen to the radio, but when I listen to the MP3 tracks, it will often freeze and so I have to take out the battery, put it back in again, and then find the songs I was listening to. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Grim

customer_reviews.title: Sadness and failure 3 days after Christmas
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Like with so many other customers, we couldn't get the thing to work after a few days of playing OK, the thing wouldn't cure itself, and the support was impossibly un-navigable. I join the many baffled and upset customers. I sent it back to Amazon (they did send a free shipping sticker), but I haven't heard anything yet. I hope I do: my daughter is waiting for a decent player.
customer_reviews.author: J. KNOWLES

customer_reviews.title: Cheap MP3 with decent sound.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in my car so I didn't have to transfer my ipod all around. Works well. Easy enough to navigate the menu. Sound is good. Battery life is decent as well. Wish it was OS X compatible but it's an older MP3 player so I didn't expect it to be. The ear buds it comes with are actually sound pretty good which I was surprised to learn. It's a good MP3 player for those who don't need a whole lot of music or those who wish to have a smaller, cheaper MP3 player to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: EuroVolk

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk Times TWO
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE this player, it is a piece of garbage! The first one I had froze after two days, so I returned it thinking it was just a lemon. When the replacement unit they sent froze after three days, I knew that I was dealing with a low quality product, totally unreliable. What sucks, too, is that there was no compensation from Amazon for the time and effort I had to put in to find a box (twice), pack it all in there (twice) and wait to hear about a replacement (twice). I am going to buy the real thing next time (iPod) because you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M. Leinweber

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mp3 player because I wanted one with an easily replaceable battery (unlike the iPod) and have been very happy with it. It's simple to use, sounds great, and, with the built-in radio and voice recorder, has more features at a lower price than the comparable iPod. The battery life is not the 19 hours they claim it is (more like 10-12) but buying a rechargeable battery takes the hassle out of that. If you're not of a mind to care that your friends might mock you for buying something Apple didn't make, buy the Sansa and enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good player for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just got my player and so far so good. My husband and 8 year old grandson have the 512 and love it. Use is straight forward. The instructions included were very basic and photocopied from something else (humm) and the color was a very hot pink. The color isn't a problem but I did want use info. Not a problem. Went to the SanDisk website and downloaded the pdf file. I'm sitting here typing and listening to the FM--without the antenna and the reception is good.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Rockin' to my Favorite Tunes
customer_reviews.text: The SanDisk Sansa MP3 player is AWESOME! It's totally plug and play. I can listen to my favorite song or listen to my local FM radio stations. Both come in amazingly clear. In other words, the sound quality is AMAZING. One of my favorite features is that I can easily choose a particular artist and listen solely to their songs if I want to. It's zero hassle. So if you're bored with what you currently have, or it's just too much drama to listen to your favorite tunes buy a SanDisk Sansa. You'll never regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Zon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Freezes after a few days
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these as Christmas gifts. I had to return both of them for replacements. After a few days they both froze during initalization. The word SANSA stays on the screen and the device is unusable. The first replacement is working fine; however, the second replacement which I received yesterday is now frozen as well. This appears to be a big problem with this model. Do a google search on "m240 freezes" and you'll see numerous people who are experiencing the same thing. On a good note, Amazon customer support has been awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good unit with user-replaceable battery
customer_reviews.text: This is an old mp3 player that has one big advantage - it runs on a AAA penlight battery, and for a long time. That means it won't become a throwaway as happens with NiMh rechargable battery players. The unit also has good audio quality, especially when used with high bit rate mp3s or wma files. I own and recommend any of the Sandisk M200 series players
customer_reviews.author: Peter V. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few weeks ago but only recently had time to use it. It is simple to operate. I printed out the directions for a guideline which I like to do since I am a "direction reader". The quality of the sound is good in both the Music and the FM Radio. I have not used the Voice Recorder as yet so cannot comment on that. The only negative I have is that 1 Gig is not a whole lot of space....but....rather than get a more expensive unit, I opted for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Backlight won't work for long with rechargeable batteries
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Sansa m240 for about six months. It plays my recorded podcasts well and battery life seems much longer than with the Creative Nano it replaced. One annoyance: I use rechargeable AAA batteries (1.2v), not alkaline AAA batteries (1.5v). I seems that the lower voltage rechargeables prevent the backlight on the display from working except when they are fully charged. Also, it feels kind of cheap in hand..but still worth the $20 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: WilW

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle Music
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an MP3 player to use while cruising on my bike. This one (the first player I've owned) sounds great and is easy to use. The only negative thing about it is its inability to play playlists that I created on my computer and then loaded to the SanDisk. It ignores folders and playlists dumped onto it and plays the songs individually or gives me the option to create playlists on the player itself which seems to be more cumbersome than doing it on the computer. --Gary
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Hoxworth

customer_reviews.title: a great value
customer_reviews.text: I am an older person who has no interest in the Ipod frenzy but wanted a small music player for the gym/car at a reasonable cost. This player fits the bill. I was able to use it easily once I figured out how to scroll. Music downloads easily through Windows media player( which recognizes the Sansa automatically). I have had no problems at all and it is so easy to simply replace the AAA battery. Recommend this highly as a really good value.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Player
customer_reviews.text: I just got my M240 the other day and absolutely love it. It is so easy to use, truly plug and play. I just fired up Media Player, plugged in the M240, hit the sync button, and it transferred all my music in no time at all. It took about 5 minutes to transfer 240 songs. The buttons are easy to use and the menu system is fairly easy as well. The backlight doesn't stay on as long as I would like, but it isn't a show stopper. A really good player and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Falcontech

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing - had one a few years ago, but it was stolen. I had the belt clip, which costs almost as much as this thing now (back 3 years ago it didn't). I run 35-40 miles/week and its perfect. You can just sy nc a playlist to it via windows media player. I love that it uses the standard USB mini plug, which almost every device has now. THe AAA battery lasts a while, only have to replace once/month for all the running I do.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 and 6 year olds. They love them. Easy to use/download music. Great that it has a radio and they love the voice recorder (who knew!?). The arm band and case are cheap and the arm band is too big to fit their arms. I'm reading a bunch of reviews today that say they freeze up...I sure hope that doesn't happen, or I'll have 2 bummed out kids. A lanyard would've been nice...but so far, great product for the price for kids.
customer_reviews.author: AZgal

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY that's lasted 5 years strong
customer_reviews.text: Update: 08-09-2012 It's still going! My favorite mp3 player ever! I totally recommend this item. It's now August 2011, so I have owned this 1GB player for almost 4 years now--and it still works great. It's not as fancy as some of the other players out there, but it's completely reliable--a great "beginner's toy." Capacity, quality, battery life, and durability are excellent. When it's time for a new one, there will be no hesitation in purchasing this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Allie.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mp3 player, very easy to navigate, load songs into from the computer. Sound is excellent. Would definately recommend this. Have seen the Ipods, and this is a much better deal. Save yourself a ton of money and skip the ipod and get one of these SanDisk mp3 players instead. Uses AAA battery, verses the ipod which charges when attached to your computer. What a pain it must be to have to charge the ipod by attaching it to the computer. Trust me a AAA battery is much easier, considering I usually put a bunch of songs on and then leave it in my purse, car, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen LEH NJ

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job... What More Could I Ask?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my girlfriend who needed nothing more than a small, highly portable mp3 playing device that she could put on her arm while she worked out, jogged, walked, mopped floors, read a book, took a nap, cooked me a nice steak dinner, or did just about any other thing she felt like doing. Thus far the item has worked just fine. I loaded it up with the music she wanted (in mp3 format) and off she went with a smile on her face. Should the need arise for me to get a portable mp3 player for myself, I will not hesitate to order another one of these SanDisk M240's.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect MP3 Player For What I Need!
customer_reviews.text: I just needed one for the gym, so i did my research and decided this would be the best 1GB player for me. I basically just read reviews online, and they were all right! Once out of the box, I hooked it up to my computer and started putting songs from my cds onto it. However, keep in mind, I'm not the quickest when it comes to computers and technology. Its pretty cool because it uses Window's Media Player. Very easy to use and navigate through the menus. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a great MP3 player for the gym or exercising. 1GB holds a lot of songs!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good little thing
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This little gadget is excellent. Very handy, you can put your MP3 music in a breeze. I use Rhapsody to upload the music in it. The device is very easy to use, has an excellent sound, FM radio and voice recorder. The battery lasts a long time, the songs can be arranged in albums very easily (you have to do that before uploading them, giving each song the correct information in its ID tag: Title, Artist, Album). Only thing I didn't like were the earphones: there are much better ones out there, so you would do yourself a favor getting a pair of new ones. The rest is just fine. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted...something simple to take along. It's very basic, but the quality is good, recording is easy and it's nearly idiot-proof. If you want to record your tunes without going broke, I really recommend this model. My only grouse is that it wouldn't work on Napster (and I think the problem is w/Napster) although it's supposed to be compatible--the main reason that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Biggles

customer_reviews.title: A better user manual would be helpful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this MP-3 player for my daughter and am generally happy with it. A couple of things that I wish I had known: 1. You need to select between the types of input on the player before your computer will recognize that you have attached it. 2. Do not purchase an iTunes card to buy music to place on an MP-3 player. It is a fairly nice MP-3 player, just a little difficult to figure out at first.
customer_reviews.author: Church Rocker

customer_reviews.title: Great MP3 Player for Little $$$
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this device for about a month. Why spend big bucks on an iPod when $75 gets you all the music you need? Plenty of battery life, easy set up, drag music files off/on with Windows Explorer. I had an email question for their support desk; they got back to me with a good answer in less than 24 hours and provided a name/phone number if I needed follow on help. The website FAQs are weak and if more comprehensive could have resolved my question. I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: John Huddy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my 46 year old husband. He loves it. No, it doesn't hold a bazillion songs, but he did get about 100 on the unit with plenty of room to spare. He also likes the radio. He uses it everyday at work and can listen to his favorite morning radio program then switch to his tunes. Maybe not a teenagers dream, but it's perfect for grownups.
customer_reviews.author: RKIF

customer_reviews.title: MP3 players New to Me
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so am up-dated enough to have Windows XP but never got a MP3 player until now. It was intimidating at first but after I downloaded the Manual in pdf I was fine. I download radio talk shows so I can listen at my leisure. No problems so far and I have been able to but over 30 hours at a time on it. The sound quality is great. I did download a song or two and they were also great.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk .mp3 Player
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these .mp3 players. One is used for downloadable mp3/wma books and this one gets used every day. The second stores my favorite tunes. Gosh, I can only save 240 of my favs, I'm really sad that I can't save 8000:-) One had a firmware problem that was easily fixed by a firmware update. These players get phenomenal battery life using AAA (usually 20+ hours). The player is easy to navigate and the sound quality (for my OLD ears) is perfectly acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Knutson

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in songs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player about 2 years ago and use it 3-5 times a week at the gym. It takes its share of abuse and keeps on going. The sound is great and the software that comes with it is fairly easy to use compared to the Rio MP3 player that this replaced after less than 90 days! In my opinion, iPods are overrated and a BIG marketing gimmic. If you're looking for a tough, basic but great sounding player that will last, I would highly recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: Film Noir Tzar

customer_reviews.title: Defective headphone jack connection
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used this player for 3 1/2 months and now need to buy another player because there is no connection when I insert the headphone jack. Reading reviews before buying I came across a complaint about this, along with the suggestion to leave the headphone jack plugged in to reduce wear and tear. I did just that, but still will need to replace an otherwise working unit.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Scandisk is awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item after looking at the other reviews on it. It does everything and more. It holds more than enough music for the average user and also comes with a Fm radio. The radio works great. I live in southeastern Michigan and get all of the radio stations clearly. It comes with everything you need. I hooked it up to windows media player and within a minute had 6 hours of music ready to play on it. All I can say is it is great for the price and does everything I wanted and more. A really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Harrison

customer_reviews.title: MP3 Player freezes up!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these on Jan. 4th. My grandson used it for less than a week before it "froze" and would not play. I returned it and ordered another one on Jan. 17...same thing happened in less than 3 days. I also returned this one. I still have not received my money back for these defective players, although Amazon emailed me today and said they will credit soon. AND my grandson still does not have an MP3 player. DON'T BUY THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Wick

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa M240 1 GB MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this purchase. I use it for Classical music I've transferred from CD's so I can listen while working in the yard or walking or whatever. I am amazed at the amount of music that a 1 GB player can store. I have no complaints about the sound quality. It took me some time to learn how to navigate around to select what I want to listen to, but can now do it. The FM radio has very good reception.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Custis

customer_reviews.title: Use every day
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one about a year ago and use it every day to listen to podcasts during my walk. I also use it the car for music and podcasts when I Travel. I made the mistake of putting some music, that my wife liked, on it and letting her it for a few days. Now I have 2 or should I say I have the old one and she has the new one. For the money you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J J

customer_reviews.title: Freezes at start up
customer_reviews.text: Our initial m240 froze on the start-up screen about a month after we got it, making it unusable. We exchanged it for another and within a week that unit also froze on the start-up screen. This product was a great value at the price, with good sound quality. Unfortunately, it's not reliable. A search online will turn up other users with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tukwillie

customer_reviews.title: Years ago
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, this project was small and compact and perfect for running. There was a velcro strap which went around my upper arm. Technology has advanced so much the past several years, I think I would now go for the higher technology. This did perform well and I used it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Buy this NEW not from a seller off Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this from any seller on Amazon except Amazon itself. Especially 3Btech (major problem seller it seems). Buy it new. It was a gift for my partner and it arrived in a box with separate plastic bags, and no manual, battery, case of the coupon for Rhapsody! So i recommend staying with official sellers, or your local technology store. And yes, avoid buying during Mercury Retrograde - I should have known better.
customer_reviews.author: NDP

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Not wanting to spend the ridiculous money on an IPOD, I opted for the SanDisk Sansa M240 1GB MP3 Player. This thing is tiny but comes with a wrist strap and a protective cover, and the sound from the headphones is actually really great. The only downer is that there isn't a menu you can scroll through to get to the folder you want to hear. But for the price and the amount of space on this player, its definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: My MP3
customer_reviews.text: This is my first MP3 player and I love it! I love that I can listen to over 200 songs or the radio. Fast shipping, awesome price. The only trouble I had was that the ear buds are too big for my ears, but that was easily remedied and not the fault of the dealer. I will definately be buying more of this item for my family members. Thank you, Malisa
customer_reviews.author: Malisa

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas. Worked for less than 30 days. Locked up and will not connect to any PC. Online customer service blamed the PC's and not their product. PC's work fine for other players, (not this brand). Don't waste your money, there are just as good players out there for the same or better prices. Still trying to get customer service to acknowledge I wish to return this. No response as yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for a little buck
customer_reviews.text: The Sansa M240 simply has more to offer than many of its competitors. With an MP3 player, of course, FM tuner, great bonus that works well and a voice recorder, that works great in meetings, classes or when your brainstorming the ideas you might want to remember, this little gem packs it in. I read one complaint that delt with sorting but, I found it easy to sort songs by artist, album, favorites... not really a big problem. For the price, it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MP3 player great for church services
customer_reviews.text: this is a great MP3 player for any simple audio application. We are using these players instead of cassette tape to provide a connection between the service and "shut-ins" in nursing homes. We use the SanDisk speaker docks. Great player, works well and the shut-in claim that the service is clearer with greater fidelity. Thanks San Disk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baskin

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes good, sometimes glitchy!
customer_reviews.text: Both my wife and I have one. When they work they're fine. But every so often, for no apparent reason, we can't delete all of the stored podcasts or the device won't accept new ones although there's plenty of storage space left. Then the device must be re-formated (sometimes several times). It's an annoying and unwanted waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Schneier

customer_reviews.title: Nice, inexpensive MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: The SanDisk Sansa m240 MP3 player was a good solution for my 9-year old boy who wanted an MP3 player, but isn't yet responsible enough for one costing $100+. It works very well with Windows Media player and has reasonable sound quality for a $40 unit. The menu is pretty intuitive and so far, everything works just like it's supposed to. I can't yet attest to the long-term durability.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edgerton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Performance and a Bargain Compared to iPod
customer_reviews.text: For the money I was expecting something cheap and lacking in features. Having owned and returned and iPod Nano I can say this is a great alternative. It comes with arm band and case so you dont need to go out an spend $20-$30 like you would with an iPod. It is light and easy to use and compatible with every music service
customer_reviews.author: CA472

customer_reviews.title: My son is happy!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this SanDisk MP3 player for our son's 11th birthday; he loves it...even though his older brothers have iPods. It is an added bonus that he can listen to his FM stations. we loved the price, especially for an 11 year old....if it gets lost or broken it's certainly less painful to replace than an iPod.
customer_reviews.author: lbskis

customer_reviews.title: For a fairly inexpensive 1 GB mp3 player...
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job, for the most part. I love this brand, but I wouldn't buy this particular player again. It can't hold very many songs, and the user manual seemed to be lacking in explanations for some things(like the voice recorder option, which I still haven't figured out). I like that it has a built-in FM radio, and the earphones are pretty comfortable. Most other earphones don't fit in my ears, but these ones are nice and padded(you have to put the pads on yourself though, which got a tad bit frustrating). Overall, a nice, cute, little mp3 player.
customer_reviews.author: Dreams of Twilight

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews before ordering this
customer_reviews.text: My player worked fine for just over one month before it froze up on the "Finalizing update" screen. This seems to happen to an unacceptably high percentage of these players. I have tried the recommended fixes, to no avail. I continue to wait for a response from Sandisk. Save yourself the trouble - you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: J.O.

customer_reviews.title: Not Well Made
customer_reviews.text: It holds a lot of music, has a simple interface, and was easy to use while it lasted. It's nice to be able to drag files from the machine to folders on your computer without dealing with the tyranny of Itunes. I treated this unit well (or so I thought) but now it won't start up. It lasted about six months. Pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cass

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I so wish they still made these. They are getting tougher to find. They were very simple and basic to operate. It is exactly what I needed for a family member who does not have the ability to maneuver the more sophisticated one out now.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Everything You Need in an MP3
customer_reviews.text: Being new to the whole IPOD thing and being basically cheap, I decided to take the plunge and get something to take on my vacation that wasn't too expensive. This SanDisk MP3 player is all I need. It works great and has an FM radio too. I already have downloaded 250 songs. It was very easy to do and the sound quality is great. If you are like me and just want something simple that does the job, this is the MP3 for you. Who needs a thousand songs anyway?? You won't be sorry with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Boker

customer_reviews.title: Too Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these now. I thought I just was too careless with the first but was careful with the second. They function fine but I use them everyday with the wrist strap and after a few months they fail at the input jack for the earphones. Be sure to use an L jack and not a straight one which breaks the input really fast. Mnky
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for grade school children who have no problem using them. Compatible and easy to upload music etc. from Windows Media Player. Only problem is that the supplied instruction booklet could have given a bit more information on how to use all of the features. However, the complete manual is available online - all 37 pages of it.
customer_reviews.author: PeeF

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mp3 player at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player about two years ago, and I still love it. I listen to it while running several miles a week, and it has even kept me motivated while running two half-marathons. I haven't had any problems with it whatsoever. It's lightweight, reliable, easy to use--and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Librarian from NC

customer_reviews.title: Player purchased new doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product newly as a gift for my sister, but after uploading the songs, the menu doesn't show up and there is no other way of interacting with it later. Moreover, it doesn't even get detected by the computer after connecting it using the USB cable. It worked once, but that's it. Afterwards, it just refuses to respond!!
customer_reviews.author: one mallu dude

customer_reviews.title: still my favorite lil' mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: still my favorite lil' mp3 player. rugged...easy to navigate by touch alone...display is just good enough to get around in it quickly...and it dries out fast and doesn't lose it's load after a dunk in the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Mom of 2
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this MP3 player for my daughters 10 birthday. This is her first and she loves it. I would recommend this player to anybody wanting a first MP3 player for their child or themselves. The only problem we have is that it locks up once in awhile, but usually if you turn it off and then turn it back on it resolves the problem. We also have it almost full of songs so that could be why it locks up sometimes. It holds about 250 songs. We also use Energizer rechargeable batteries because a friend told us it drains the batteries pretty quick and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rana M. Murzda

customer_reviews.title: My 10-yr old loves this mp3 player!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mp3 player for my daughter for Christmas (who was then 9). She absolutely loves it. The player locked up one time, but once I took the battery out, put it back in, and turned it back on, it worked fine, and we haven't had any problems since. It's been 5 months, and it's still going strong. I would recommend this player. The only thing is when I ordered this back in November'07, I only paid about $30 (including shipping), so I don't know what's up with this current price of $99.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Correction - one worked and one froze up
customer_reviews.text: I previously did a review regarding how this player froze up, within 3 days, and that I was returning both. I did decide to try the second one and what do you know, that one is working fine so far. Hmmmmm. So, one works and one doesn't. Guess the problem isn't with me or my computer, but rather a bad batch of MP3 players.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my fiance last Christmas. He probably used in 10 times and it completely stopped working. He was using it one day, paused it and ever since it has been completely frozen. We called Sansa customer service and the guy did not seem at all surprised. Told us what to do. DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE VISTA... DOES NOT WORK WITH THIS OPERATING SYSTEM!! So we had to use his grandmother's XP version and it still doesn't work. The guy said there is nothing they can do! Only used 10 times... totally not worth the money... even though it's pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Rachie

customer_reviews.title: Nice MP3
customer_reviews.text: Owned one of these for a couple of years with no issues. I use the player 4-5 times per week during workouts...I strongly suggest you buy the M200 Silicone case with the player...The unit seems to be fragile if not protected. You also want to buy upgraded earphones. JLab's at Amazon are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my father's Christmas present. He loved it and the three different things it does. It not only plays mp3's it also has a mic to make recordings on it and it has a FM tuner. He loves that he can listen to the radio on it. It's a great product even with buying it refurbished we haven't had any problems with it. It interfaces well with window's media player and it easy to use. The buttons are easy to push and the screen is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: ashwolf83

customer_reviews.title: CAVEAT EMPTOR!
customer_reviews.text: The player worked as advertised for nearly two weeks, then as with other reviewers, it froze on the start-up screen and would not respond at all! Also regardless of the player having failed I would have hoped to have purchased a better designed player. Overall the modest price is no consolation! *update* I mailed this item back to Amazon on Jan 4 via USPS and Amazon confirmed receiving it on Jan 12. After two emails and one phone call I finally received my refund on Feb 14! I will never purchase from Amazon again!
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Goat

customer_reviews.title: This MP3 player would be nice if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a few days and then died. Exchanged for another one thinking we just got a bad one. That one worked for a few weeks and then died in the exact same way as the previous one. The MP3 player is a nice design, but it just doesn't work. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: D.STEP

customer_reviews.title: Big MP3 player, low price
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased 3 of these MP3 players for 3 different family members. It is very easy to use which was important for my daughter, father-in-law and mother-in-law all of whom are electronics novices. Battery life is excellent, and you really can't beat the memory size and price.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Frederick

customer_reviews.title: works good for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this despite the negative reviews and found it easy to use and durable (I dropped it while bike riding). I had none of the problems others have had with this. I love it. I even bought another when I was given a gift card to another appliance store. I now have music on both and carry them with me all the time. I love that it can also be a tape recorder.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third SanDisk mp3 player. I still do not understand how to use it. I have asked for help from the company before, but the language barrier did not help. You must know what you are doing before you purchase one of these. I do not like the earbuds and so purchased my own headphones. I also purchased an FM transmitter from SanDisk that doesnt work at all. This should be for people that already know how these devices work. I am i computer programmer and it was too hard for me! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: tiffanydw2

customer_reviews.title: Stacks up to IPOD
customer_reviews.text: The only thing you don't get with this is the software that the other guys give you that does everything in it's power to make you pay for new music. So you have to know how to rip your cd's and load them into this, but for someone with a cd collection dating back to the late 80's, and that was a member of the BMG music club over those years, this is a great way to pick and choose your favorite songs from your entire collection for those boring flights across the county. The ear buds are okay, but you can afford noise cancelling headphones with the savings here.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murray

customer_reviews.title: freeze
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for our daughter and gave it her for christmas. it froze the day after christmas and refused to work ever again. we returned this to amazon and decided to buy the creative zen 1 GB nano. i wasn't about to risk spending money on another sansa and having it break after any amount of time again. i am extremely pleased with the creative zen and encourage anyone to purchase this item instead of the san disk mp3 player!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Penello

customer_reviews.title: I would definately recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: I think this MP3 player is a great buy for the money, the sound is great and the price is right. I was going to buy the I-Pod but it was a little out of my price range, this is a quarter of the cost and works excellently. I wish I could fit more songs on it, but that doesn't take away from the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT!
customer_reviews.text: AFTER THE INTERNAL BATTERY DIED IN MY OLD MP3, I DECIDED MY NEXT ONE WOULD HAVE A REPLACEABLE BATTERY. SO AFTER LOTS OF RESEARCH AND READING REVIEWS I DECIDED ON THIS ONE. SO FAR I HAVE BEEN VERY PLEASED WITH THIS ONE, AND WHEN THE BATTERY GETS LOW I SWAP IT OUT WITH FRESH RECHARGEABLE ONE. NOW I DONT HAVE TO THROW THE PLAYER AWAY WHEN THE BATTERY QUITS.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCK

customer_reviews.title: MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: A christmas present for my daughter - I scored! She absolutely loves it and keeps thanking me for it. The delivery was timely and the retailer did a great job packaging the player so the daughter wouldn't know what arrived by mail. Overall this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Was lost outside in the weather for three years. Simply put in a new battery and works great. Anyone else beat that. Can get other headphones for running with little cost. Fantastic product. Running with it today.
customer_reviews.author: horas1

customer_reviews.title: Still have it after several years
customer_reviews.text: This little player never dies! It works great and I put my podcasts on it. Sometimes I have to reformat it before I add more material, but it has always worked consistently.
customer_reviews.author: N. R. C.

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa 1GB MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: The software provided with the unit worked well, I bought another mp3 player from another manufacturer that locked up the computer. The menus are easy to use, and it has a nice feature where you can pause the music and the Sansa MP3 player will automatically shut off if you don't hit the play button again. My only complaint is the unit eats a lot of batteries- it is best to go with rechargables. I get about 6 hrs playback time per battery.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: MP3 SanDisk
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the MP3 I purchased for my husband for a Christmas gift. It trully holds a couple hundred songs. It automatically alphabetizes songs by artists, genre, and song, etc. That is a great feature. And it also has a recording device. Great for little messages t yourself or your significant other. The product works wonderfully. I would purchase another for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Howard J. Short

customer_reviews.title: Positive review of SanDisk
customer_reviews.text: My kids and wife all have an iPod but I couldn't justify the cost because I don't use it that often so I bought the SanDisk. I've used it on two cross country airline trips thus far and it has been great. Easy to set up and download music. Besides being less expensive it has performed very well. Great product thus far.
customer_reviews.author: W. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: mp 3 player
customer_reviews.text: When I 1st got the player the volume button was stuck on Loud, and that was my only complaint. All I wanted was to switch it out to another one, But anyways' You can not turn it down at all. I emailed the company several times with no response at all I tried calling the 1800 number but no response. Now I love Amazon But I will Not Buy from this company ever again. Terrible Customer Service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't consider this. It's awful.
customer_reviews.text: It seems it has a firmware bug that causes a lockup when a file is corrupted, which can happen when you disconnect the player and a file is not completely written (No indication is given when the file writing is complete). This sort of problem would have come out in the most rudimentary testing, which says to me that they don't test their products at all and rely on the consumer to do their product testing. I for one will not be purchasing any more Sansa products, and I recommend that you don't either. If you do buy it, firmware upgrades won't help once the lockup occurs, so update it immediately when the stinking thing arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: sansa 240
customer_reviews.text: This is a great MP3 player for the money. The sound is amazing for such a tiny device, and loading songs is easy and quick. I have nearly all my favorite songs on my player with room to spare. I like mine so well, I bought one for my husband for Christmas, and he loves his player,too.
customer_reviews.author: M Stern

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It arrived quickly and it looks practically ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It arrived quickly and it looks practically new. I have purchased many different mp3 players and Sansa makes a very good player. Easy to use for an old lady who isn't tecnically inclined. I like the older models because I can swap out the battery and hear my tunes all day long at work.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

product_meta.title: SanDisk Sansa m240 1 GB MP3 Player (Silver) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingRock to your favorite tunes! This SanDisk Sansa m240 MP3 Player features1 GB flashmemory that holds over16 hours/240 songs of MP3 music or over32 hours/480 songs of WMA music. Access your local FM broadcasts and up to 20 of your favorite stations with the digital FM tuner! Capture your thoughts with the built-in microphone and voice recording function! With USB 2.0 interface, you can connect the Sansa m240 to almost computer for high speed data transfers. Everything you need to enjoy digital music is with this SanDisk Sansa m240 MP3 Player !

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description Weighing not much more than its power source (a single AAA battery), the Sansa m240 1 GB flash memory digital audio player is a full-featured, ultra-portable MP3 player. The m240 includes FM radio and voice recording, a backlit LCD screen that displays ID3 tag information, support for multiple file formats, and full compatibility with most subscription services.

The Sansa M240 can hold 16 hours of CD-quality MP3 tracks on its 1 GB memory.

Detailed view of the basic controls. 

The Music LCD screen. 

The FM Radio LCD screen. 

Top Level Menu. Take Your Music With You
The 1 GB Sansa m240 will hold approximately 16 hours of CD-quality MP3 tracks (encoded at 128kps) or 32 hours of WMA tracks (at 64kbps). It's compatible with MP3, WMA, secure WMA, and Audible audio file formats. The backlit LCD screen shows ID3 tag information for the currently playing track (song title, artist and album). Navigate the music on your player with ease, sorting by artist, album, song title, playlist or other criteria. With five equalizer types, you can optimize your sound for your favorite style of music, such as, Rock, Jazz, Classical, Pop, and Custom (user-defined). Keep the music coming with up to 19 hours continuous playback using one AAA Battery. 

FM Radio
The m240 includes a digital FM radio tuner for portable radio listening. Easily access your favorite stations by adding them to one of the 20 presets. 

Voice Recording Included
Use the built-in microphone to capture interviews, classes, short notes to yourself, or anything else you might feel inspired to record. 

Peace of Mind With PlaysForSure
The SanDisk Sansa m240 digital audio player uses PlaysForSure technology. Look for the PlaysForSure logo if you want to make sure the digital music and video you purchase will play back on it every time. Match the PlaysForSure logo on a large selection of leading devices and online music stores. If you see the logo, you'll know your digital music will play for sure. Choose from a large number of digital music and video stores, including MTV's Urge, Rhapsody, Yahoo!, MSN Music, MusicMatch, MusicNow, Napster, Wal-Mart Music Downloads, and many more. 

Ease of Operation
To transfer songs to the Sansa, simply connect the device to your PC via the included USB 2.0 cable. The device will appear as a drive in the Windows Explorer. Just drag and drop your compatible music files and be on your way. Additionally, use a variety of music software to move licensed music to the device. Works with Windows XP and Windows Media Player 9 or later. 

What's in the Box
Sansa m240 MP3 Player, Earphones, Armband and Case, AAA battery, USB 2.0 travel cable, and Quick Start Guide.
feature_bullets: Lightweight flash memory digital audio player--weighs just 1.5 ounces
1 GB memory holds 16 hours of MP3 and 32 hours of WMA audio
Microsoft PlaysForSure support for compatibility with wide range of online stores and subscription services
Integrated FM radio with 20 presets; built-in microphone and voice recorder
Powered by single AAA battery, for up to 19 hours of usage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars952 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
